title: raftstore: panicked due to trying to apply a tombstone region already existed in kv engine

comments_data.body: Seems the fix #8084 still has the race condition.

Suppose a is split into b and a, there is also an uninitialized replicated peer b', which is supposed to be b.

There are three cases:
1. b' is destroyed after replace peer collection but before the state check, it will lead to this panic;
2. b' is destroyed after the state check, there will be new race conditions between writing tombstone state of b' and writing split state of b;
3. b' is destroyed before the split check and then add a new peer c before the a accepts a snapshot and split.

1 will lead to panic as shown in this issue. 2 will lead to stale peer with apply state set to `Tombstone`. 3 will work as expected because b will not be considered replace-able, so it will be skipped when seeing tombstone state of b'.

To fix 1, it should just remove the replace assert. To fix 2, when destroying a peer that is marked to be replaced, it should not write the tombstone state. It requires holding the pending_create_peer locks during destroy for those replaced peer.
